body.head: Paul Graener [Gräner] (born Berlin, Jan 11, 1872; died Salzburg, Nov 13, 1944)

div.p: Paul Graener [Gräner] (born Berlin, Jan 11, 1872; died Salzburg, Nov 13, 1944), German conductor and composer.

Trained at the Veit Conservatory, Graener held conducting positions in Germany and England, then in 1908 joined the New Conservatory in Vienna. He was made a professor of the Berlin Akademie der Künste in 1920 and succeeded Reger at the Leipzig Conservatory. He was Director of the Berlin Stern'sches Conservatorium 1930-33, where he also took masterclasses. A member of the National Socialist Kampfbund für Deutsche Kultur, he became vice-president of the Reichsmusikkammer 1933-41.
